name: Default Document List Table
folder: UNO-1984 - Worker Document Upload Maintenance Page
testScript:
• Table to display the documents that have been Added as
    default documents using above add functionality
    • Document Name
      • Document Name displayed
    • Uploaded on
      • Date document uploaded
      • Date format DD/MM/YYYY
    • Mandatory
      • Yes or no displayed based on whether tick
        box was ticked or not while adding the
        document name
    • Edit Button
      • When clicked, a pop up box to display
        the Document Name and the Mandatory
        question – both able to be edited
      • Save and Cancel Buttons
      • Once Save clicked, the details are to
        be updated in the Document List
      • Once Cancel clicked, no changes are
        to be saved
    • Delete Button
      • When clicked popup window to say 'are you
        sure you want to delete the document from
        the list?' with Yes and No Buttons
        • Yes selected - TBC
        • No – No changes made
justification: Tests core grid functionality, involves CRUD operations, and validates mandatory fields; however, it does not cover security-related functions.

name: Verify that as a Neuven User  when I create A Client there is a way of typing in the county as well as searching via a dropdown list.
folder: UNO-2012 - Client set up County Dropdown Issue
testScript:
Given:
  • Logged on as a Neuven User
When:
  • On the client set up page.
Then:
  •  Creating a new client and I select a county I am able to type the country name in/  tab. as well as search via the drop down.
  • When the new client is saved it remembers the county correctly.
justification: Covers core functionality related to client setup, involves data entry and verification, and handles dropdown and text input functionalities.

name: Verify that as a Client User - I cant create a shift in T&A that has and over running break.
testScript:
Given:
  • Logged in as a Client User. 
When :
  • On the T&A screen
Then:
  • Create a new time and attendance
  • Add a break for this time and attendance of 1 hour And set the end date later that the shift end date.
  • I am expecting to get an error message stating that the break end time should be within the shift start and end time.
justification: Involves validation of data input constraints, critical business functionality, and ensures data integrity.

name: Verify that there is a currency dropdown on the Agency BACS Export.
testScript:
Given :
  • Logged on as a Neuven,  with View invoices or Manage invoices permission.
When:
  • On the invoices , Agency BACS export page
Then:
  • The advanced filters should have an option for currency.

justification: Tests multiple components (UI dropdown, data filtering), and involves financial data operations.

name: Verify that there is a currency Column on the Agency BACS Export
testScript:

justification: Tests multiple components (UI table, data filtering), and involves financial data operations.

name: Verify the as a Client User the multi-currency on the VIEW time sheets page changes.
testScript:
Given:

  • Logged in as a Client User with Enter Timesheet Permissions.

When: 

  • On the time sheet adjustment page > time sheet table displayed 

Then:

  • The Currency Column is displayed next to the location column.

  • The Currency Column displays the relevant Currency that the client is linked to.

  • The Currency Column displays the relevant Symbol for that Currency.

  • The changes to the currency are found in the following columns: Bonus, Exp and total cost.
justification: Tests an important functionality (multi-currency display), involves data manipulation and user roles, but not complex enough for higher priority.

name: Verify the ERNI Tab changes to the administration page when logged in as a Neuven User.
testScript:
Given:

  • Logged on as a Neuven User.

When:

  • In the administration tab > WTR, ERNI, VAT, NMV, Neuven Fee page > the ERNI tab

Then:

  • The ERNI field has been renamed to ERNI/PRSI.
  • Country dropdown is available on the page.
  • The currency field should reflect the default currency for the country selected.
  • THE ERNI exempt amount field should say ERNI/PRSI and the correct currency symbol is shown. 
  • The ERNI History Table is called ERNI/PRSI Table, 
  • The exempt amount column should display the correct currency symbol.
justification: Involves admin-level changes and currency display affecting financial data, thus moderate priority.

testScript:

When :

Then :

justification: This test verifies the end-to-end booking process after authorization, ensuring that all steps are correctly followed and the system behaves as expected. It covers multiple stages in the booking lifecycle.

testScript:
Given :

When :

Then :

justification: This test ensures that the booking status is correctly updated at each stage of the process. It ensures visibility and accurate representation of the booking lifecycle, which impacts multiple business processes.

testScript:

  • When logged on as a user with authorize bookings permissions.
When :

  • Select a completed booking.
Then :

  • This sets the booking back to pending status.
justification: This test verifies the restrictions on editing completed bookings, ensuring that only specific actions (like adjusting worker numbers) are allowed. It covers business rules and permissions, ensuring data integrity.

name: Verify as a NEUVEN user that all fields save correctly when creating a direct bank worker profile.  - User details tab
testScript:
Given:

Logged in as a Neuven user with ‘Manage Direct Bank Worker’ permission.

When: 

On the direct bank workers page > Click ‘Add New Direct Bank Worker’ button

Then:

User is redirected to a page to crate a new direct bank worker.

  • A drop or click to upload a worker image. - search google for an image to upload. 

  • An input filed for first name - enter text (this should allow special characters and be alphanumerical )

  • An input field for last name - enter text (this should allow special characters and be alphanumerical )

  • An input field for email - enter text (this should allow special characters and be alphanumerical )

  • Address line one - this should  allow special characters and  be alphanumerical

  • Address line two -  this should  allow special characters and  be alphanumerical

  • Town - this should  allow special characters and  be alphanumerical 

  • Postcode -  this should  allow special characters and  be alphanumerical

  • Country- this should show a dropdown of different countries. 

  • Date of birth  - this should allow the user to select a date in the past form a load calendar. 

  • Gender - this should be a dropdown with options to preselect.

  • Click save details, the detailed should save without any error .t test this by searching for the file that you have just saved and opening the record an viewing this page again.
justification: This test is more comprehensive as it checks data saving functionality for a critical user management process and validates input handling.

name: Verify that as a NEUVEN user the when editing the user details tab of a direct bank workers profile the changes save correctly .

  • On the direct bank workers page > search for an existing direct bank worker > and select edit.
Then:

  • Search for the record again and click edit.

name: Verify the changes to the worker upload screen DBW for NEUVEN USERS
testScript:
Given

  • Logged in as a Neuven user with Manage Direct Bank Worker Permission 

When 

  • On the Direct Worker Page > Click Upload Worker 

Then

  • A popup will appear
  • The popup will have 2 tabs
  • The worker upload tab and the worker roll back tab. 
  • On the WORKER UPLOAD TAB
    1. Enable users to upload file from their PC. 
    2. Template download button 
    3. ‘upload’ button. 
  • On the WORKER ROLL BACK TAB. 
    1. Enter batch Id text box 
    2. If batch id is valid, it will remove all uploaded direct bank worker details 
    3. If the batch ID in not valid error message will appear stating: ‘Enter Valid Batch ID’
justification: Tests a critical business process (upload screen changes), involves multiple steps and integration points, covers user permissions.
